document.full_text: general motors co  killed its minivan in the u.s. market thanks to its soccer-mom stigma, but the automaker has carved out a high-priced niche for the vehicle as a chauffeur-driven executive ride in china.
document.title: gm minivan gone in u.s., but still thrives in china
lines_and_colors: general motors co  killed its minivan in the u.s. market thanks to its soccer-mom stigma, but the automaker has carved out a high-priced niche for the vehicle as a chauffeur-driven executive ride in china.
